alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:53PM CDT until further notice by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo, Sumter and Hale Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the last 24 hours will create rises along the Tombigbee River near Demopolis Lock and Dam. Another statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 68.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands in the area occurs and cattle should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 57.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning and continue rising to 75.4 feet Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 68.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
